block.p: A Bronx woman who was injured when her boat was struck by a 324-foot barge on Long Island Sound this month has been removed from life support, according to Newsday. The woman, Leibe Ociele Medina, 47, was on a fishing trip on a 24-foot boat off Sands Point on June 10 when a collision with a barge damaged the vessel, the police said. She was taken to St. Francis Hospital in Roslyn, where she remained in a coma. A doctor told her family on Friday that she was brain-dead, her daughter, Yuli Conely, told Newsday for yesterday's edition. The Coast Guard and the Nassau County police are investigating the collision.
